net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Class Range

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Range

  • public class Range
extends Object
    Inclusive range as defined in HTTP 1.1.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • areRangesSatisfiable

        static boolean areRangesSatisfiable(List<Range> ranges,
                           long resourceLength)
        Test if the specified ranges are satisfiable. This should be called before mergeAndOrderRanges(List, long) so we can respond with an error to abusive requests - we don't want to foster a codependent relationship.
        Parameters:
        ranges - the ranges to test.
        resourceLength - the resource length.
        Returns:
        true or false. Usually when false the servlet will return a 416 error.

      • mergeAndOrderRanges

        static List<Range> mergeAndOrderRanges(List<Range> ranges,
                              long resourceLength)
        Merge and order the ranges. This implementation merges overlapping ranges and returns them in an order that they can be output by reading a data stream with a monotonically increasing position.
        Parameters:
        ranges - a mutable list of ranges.
        resourceLength - the resource length.
        Returns:
        the specified list of ranges or a new mutable list of ranges.

      • overlaps

        public boolean overlaps(Range range,
               long resourceLength)
        Test if this range overlaps with the specified range.
        Parameters:
        range - the range.
        resourceLength - the resource length.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • parseRangeHeader

                    String rangeHeader)
        Parse the range header value and append to the specified list.
        Parameters:
        rangeList - the range list.
        rangeHeader - the header value.
